file_content.text: Pardon me, but I have several young widows who require my immediate attention. Thank you for bringing those supplies.
You're certainly not a resident here, and you're no separatist. You must be that hotshot freighter captain Viidu described over the holo.
He didn't tell me how gorgeous you are. I find your people irresistibly charming.
He failed to express how beautiful you are, though. Color me impressed.
I'm amazed you made it here in one piece. You must have a scoundrel's luck.
These poor, starving ladies and I are very grateful for the supplies you've brought. If I wasn't so exhausted, I'd throw you a party.
I don't need a party--just information.
That's really not necessary.
Excellent. That's my main stock in trade these days.
What are all these women doing here?
Starving ladies?
Their husbands died defending Talloran against the separatists. Poor things. Now I look after them.
Credits are better.
Fine, fine. I'm too tired to argue with you. I'll arrange for some credits to be transferred into your account.
Viidu said you're seeking information on a particular separatist named Skavak. The only place to find personnel data like that is at Mannett Point.
The separatists have a computer station on that island, but security there is rather insane. You'll want to use my lucky secret entrance.
Like the man says, it's better to be lucky than to be good.
Always pick luck over skill.
I prefer to be both, but to each their own.
And just how would you know about any hidden doors?
Secret entrance?
Sounds pretty far-fetched.
I understand your skepticism, Captain, but I assure you it's entirely misplaced.
I used to acquire quality goods at a discount on Mannett Point. I discovered all manner of shortcuts through the island's warehouses.
I kept detailed schematics of every maintenance passage and tunnel there. Unfortunately, I had to abandon those schematics when I fled Mannett Point.
Lost schematics aren't exactly helpful, pal.
Then they're no good to me.
I never said they were lost. I'm sure they're right where I left them.
But you know how to get them?
I always have a brilliant plan. It's why I'm still alive.
You want your precious kit of supplies? Give me something useful.
No schematics, no survival.
How could I refuse such a friendly bargain?
My schematics are still in my former home. However, I short-circuited the building's door and sealed it shut when I left.
The only way to re-open the door is by disrupting Mannett Point's power relays.
There's gotta be an easier way to get inside.
Can't I blast it?
I secured my home quite thoroughly against unwanted intruders. Criminals frighten me.
You expect me to run around separatist territory shutting down their power?
That's crazy.
I never said this was going to be easy.
Sounds good.
I'm glad you think so.
Once you gain entry, you'll find my schematics cleverly disguised as an extraordinarily tedious treatise on bird watching.
Don't worry, I'll teach you the code I used to conceal my schematics. You won't die of boredom reading about rare waterfowl.
If I do all this for nothing, I'll be back for you, pal.
I'd better not.
Perfectly understandable. I hope you'll at least be sporting and give me a head start.
Let's get started.
Teach me, already!
Oh, Captain--you really must learn to slow down and enjoy life.
Now pay attention and listen carefully, because you really don't want to hear this twice....
... and replace every mention of the Mantellian flutterplume with the number three. Did you get all that?
I nodded off once or twice there. You weren't kidding about the boredom.
More or less.
Imagine how dull it was to write the blasted thing.
That's the most sadistic way to hide information I've ever heard.
Blast, that was awful!
Then you clearly haven't lived enough.
Don't treat me like an idiot unless you want a face full of blaster.
I'm not stupid.
Apologies, Captain. I was simply trying to spare you the agony of running all the way back here for another go.
Once you read my schematics, the way into the separatist computer station will become clear. Unfortunately, that only solves half your problems.
The separatists encrypt all their files. You'll need special equipment to decipher their data. That's Viidu's area of expertise, not mine.
How am I supposed to remember all these blasted instructions?
This is way too complicated.
You're a clever sort. I'm confident you'll be just fine.
What kind of gadget will decode those separatist files?
Special equipment?
At the very least, you're going to need a top-quality slicer kit. Viidu is probably your best bet for obtaining one of those.
I hate complications.
Try taking care of a half-dozen war widows sometime. It's a wonder I get any sleep. Not that I'm complaining, mind you.
I'll take those supplies now, if you don't mind. These poor ladies could use some cheering up.
You're sure you want to stay here?
Why not leave?
Oh, I could never abandon these darling women. Whatever would they do without me?
It's disgusting how you take advantage of these women.
You're a pig, Reki.
What do you suppose the separatists would do to them without me around? I'm doing them a favor, trust me.
Don't be so quick to judge. These ladies adore me for a reason.
Have fun.
Indeed it is. Life here may be perilous, but it has its benefits.
Good luck on Mannett Point. I suggest you plot your next move with Viidu before going there.
Enjoy your bonus with my compliments--it should arrive in your account shortly. Farewell, Captain.
Be a sport and kill some separatists on your way out of here. Goodbye, Captain.
Please, we don't want any trouble. We're just trying to survive this siege.
